channel.title: Starting a little project
channel.description:
[center][size=18pt]Project: Give back[/size][/center]
I'm not very good at making a "wow" kind of showcase so work with me here.
This project is based off of the RS2011 website and it includes an SMF theme and a fully functional admin panel to add news, images, update links etc to the homepage. I'd like to have it integrated with a rsps so when someone logs in they see how many messages are read/unread, recent posts etc. This is what I have so far:
http://screencloud.net/v/Dfnt
http://screencloud.net/v/9Np0
http://screencloud.net/v/F9jM
http://screencloud.net/v/cvlp
The last picture is the news and video admin panel.
Why do I want to do this? I have been registered on mopar since 08 and haven't given a thing so I guess you could say this is how I want to contribute.
Why am I posting this? I am looking for assistance. I am not a designer and would destroy the smf theme if I am held responsible for it. Doing this project by myself would take me a while being where I am and having a team would not only make this produce itself quicker but give others the opportunity to further their skills in w/e they are helping with.
"I wan't to help! What are the requirements?" There really isn't any. If you want to help some way or another just know what you are doing and want to help with. If you just want to assist in changing the CSS files for the forums a bit than you can!
After this project is complete I plan on releasing it on this website allowing others to do whatever they want and provide support in setting it up.
So far TheWebGuy and I are the only ones working on this.
If this gets attention then I will start showing progress. Thanks for reading this ridiculously long thread and I hope to see you contribute!

item.title: Starting a little project
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

So far, I’m enjoying RoR. It’s a lot different than what I’m used to but really easy at the same time.

In fact, I am going to start by using Ruby to create the news on the homepage. Thanks Ashi

item.title: Starting a little project
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:16, topic:547886”]Psst. If you think Rails is bloated you can either use:

Sinatra, and add in gems for activemodel, and other middlewear.

Rails API (Slimmer version of Rails)

or if you’re not a pussy,

Rails

Or you can full blown Java and use Spring.[/quote]
I had originally included Sinatra in the post as an alternative but there’s no point in making him think mixing the languages is needed.

Fk Spring use Flask or Node.js

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a little project
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

jal knight:

I’m not experienced with rails D: vain said he would put together an smf theme if I grab the 2011 rs forum images and css. Anyone else want a part?

Don’t mix PHP and rails. I wouldn’t even use Rails for this, it’s too bloated for a small project imo.

TL;DR do what the rest of the forum does and don’t listen to ashi

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a little project
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:547886”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666794.msg4458467#msg4458467 date=1416249283]

Glad you got into web development, Brian.

I think Vain already done this for this template, though. Or maybe it was highscores he wrote. I’m not sure. It’s worth looking into before you go any farther with the project I guess.

Best of luck.

The last RS-related template I saw released was the RS3 highscores by The Web Guy, but hell, I’ve been wrong before.

Was a long, long time ago he released it. Good few years ago I think. I seem to remember going to rewrite the PHP to it due to a vulnerability or something.

June 8th 2014 is not years ago:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,662661.msg4428891.html#msg4428891
[/quote]
Not that one you goon the one that Vain made.[/quote]
Ooooooh okay. My bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Starting a little project
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:
